TerrainDef.Name: AttomachineBase
TerrainDef.label: attomachinery
TerrainDef.description: Ultra clean flooring which looks absolutely stunning. This floor almost looks alive with it's amount of detail. Anyone would be in awe just from standing on a tile.

TerrainDef.label: attowood
TerrainDef.description: Attomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of natural oak. It is virtually indistinguishable from wood, apart from the patterns.

TerrainDef.label: red attocarpet
TerrainDef.description: Attomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of a rich red carpet. This carpet analogue seems to feel just like red shag carpet. It's perfectly lovable.

TerrainDef.label: blue attocarpet
TerrainDef.description: Attomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of a deep blue carpet. This carpet analogue feels like a shallow stream, perfect temperature. It leaves no residue or uncomfort.

TerrainDef.label: green attocarpet
TerrainDef.description: Attomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of a mossy green carpet. This one feels like short, dense and lush grass on ones feet. For the nature head.

TerrainDef.label: cream attocarpet
TerrainDef.description: Attomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of a creamy white carpet. This one feels like walking through whipped cream, although it leaves no residue or smell that would state otherwise.

TerrainDef.label: gray attocarpet
TerrainDef.description: Attomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of a dark gray carpet. Surpisingly, this carpet analogue feels so neutral that one can't help but feel indifferent to it. It's not boring, just evidently professional.

TerrainDef.label: natural attomachinery
TerrainDef.description: The natural state of the attomachinery. With this deep green it seems to phase between a concrete analogue and a carpet.

TerrainDef.label: attosoil
TerrainDef.description: The Attomachines pull energy from the quantum foam in order to nutriate the plant beyond comprehension. It perfectly assembles itself in such a way that the plant is perfectly grown within no time at all.

TerrainDef.Name: PicomachineBase
TerrainDef.label: picomachinery
TerrainDef.description: Ultra clean flooring which looks stunning. This floor almost looks alive with it's amount of detail. Anyone would be in awe just from standing on a tile.

TerrainDef.label: picowood
TerrainDef.description: Picomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of natural mahogany. It is virtually indistinguishable from wood, apart from the patterns.

TerrainDef.label: red picocarpet
TerrainDef.description: Picomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of a rich red carpet. This carpet analogue seems to feel just like red shag carpet. It's perfectly lovable.

TerrainDef.label: blue picocarpet
TerrainDef.description: Picomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of a deep blue carpet. This carpet analogue feels like a shallow stream, perfect temperature. It leaves no residue or uncomfort.

TerrainDef.label: green picocarpet
TerrainDef.description: Picomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of a mossy green carpet. This one feels like short, dense and lush grass on ones feet. For the nature head.

TerrainDef.label: cream picocarpet
TerrainDef.description: Picomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of a creamy white carpet. This one feels like walking through whipped cream, although it leaves no residue or smell that would state otherwise.

TerrainDef.label: gray picocarpet
TerrainDef.description: Picomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of a dark gray carpet. Surpisingly, this carpet analogue feels so neutral that one can't help but feel indifferent to it. It's not boring, just evidently professional.

TerrainDef.label: natural picomachinery
TerrainDef.description: The natural state of the picomachinery. With this deep purple it seems to phase between a concrete analogue, carpet, and wood.

TerrainDef.label: picosoil
TerrainDef.description: Picomachines which simulate the near perfect environment for any plant. It first scans the plant, finds out what it needs, and then provides it perfectly, allowing for perfect growth rates.

TerrainDef.Name: NanomachineBase
TerrainDef.label: nanomachinery
TerrainDef.description: Ultra clean flooring which looks stunning. This floor almost looks alive with it's amount of detail. Anyone would be in awe just from standing on a tile.

TerrainDef.label: nanowood
TerrainDef.description: Nanomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of natural chestnut. It is virtually indistinguishable from wood, apart from the patterns.

TerrainDef.label: red nanocarpet
TerrainDef.description: Nanomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of a rich red carpet. This carpet analogue seems to feel just like red shag carpet. It's perfectly lovable.

TerrainDef.label: blue nanocarpet
TerrainDef.description: Nanomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of a deep blue carpet. This carpet analogue feels like a shallow stream, perfect temperature. It leaves no residue or uncomfort.

TerrainDef.label: green nanocarpet
TerrainDef.description: Nanomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of a mossy green carpet. This one feels like short, dense and lush grass on ones feet. For the nature head.

TerrainDef.label: cream nanocarpet
TerrainDef.description: Nanomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of a creamy white carpet. This one feels like walking through whipped cream, although it leaves no residue or smell that would state otherwise.

TerrainDef.label: gray nanocarpet
TerrainDef.description: Nanomachines which have restructured and coloured themselves to the texture and colour of a dark gray carpet. Surpisingly, this carpet analogue feels so neutral that one can't help but feel indifferent to it. It's not boring, just evidently professional.

TerrainDef.label: natural nanomachinery
TerrainDef.description: The natural state of the nanomachinery. With this deep blue it seems to phase between a concrete analogue, carpet, and wood.

TerrainDef.label: nanosoil
TerrainDef.description: The nanomachines reconfigure themselves into a soil like analogue, while also simulating nutrients and certain trace elements perfect for growing. While not as good as Picosoil or Attosoil, it certainly is a step up from regular dirt.
